title: ICE during mir inlining: None in  compiler/rustc_mir_transform/src/inline.rs:185:32

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code code from `./src/test/ui/abi/rustcall-generic.rs` ```Rust // check-pass #![feature(unboxed_closures)] extern "rust-call" fn foo(_: T) {} fn main() { foo(()); foo((1, 2)); } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.64.0-nightly (6a1092056 2022-07-02) binary: rustc commit-hash: 6a1092056441652fe5fe5c5b422644951e6b99ce commit-date: 2022-07-02 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.64.0-nightly LLVM version: 14.0.6 ``` ### Error output `rustc ./src/test/ui/abi/rustcall-generic.rs -Zmir-opt-level=3` ``` ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', compiler/rustc_mir_transform/src/inline.rs:185:32 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7fc9952a1b00 - std::backtrace_rs::backtrace::libunwind::trace::h5f5188fd44a6fa3f at /rustc/6a1092056441652fe5fe5c5b422644951e6b99ce/library/std/src/../../backtrace/src/backtrace/mod.rs:66:5 1: 0x7fc9952a1b00 -
